intro: Paepalanthus karstenii f. corei, commonly known as the Core's pincushion plant, is a unique succulent native to South America. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage that resembles a pincushion. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or white. It thrives in arid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental appeal, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a decorative plant.
